entry.title: Product Compliance in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Product Compliance in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected with close collaboration with our product management teams focused on asset management.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Product Compliance Foundation

  • Continuous content delivery for product marketability and safety data sheet compliance requirements

Dangerous Goods Management

  • Visualization of information for ADR and RID 1.1.3.6
  • Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents
  • Integration of mixed loading checks for dangerous goods in sales, delivery, and transportation management
  • Printing dangerous-goods freight documents in transportation management

Safety Data Sheet and Label Management

  • Supporting multi-component products for two or more products in the safety data sheet process
  • Support for branded products in the safety data sheet process

 

Product Compliance Foundation

Continuous content delivery for product marketability and safety data sheet compliance requirements

Business Background

Staying current with ever-changing global regulations is a significant challenge for businesses that market and ship products worldwide. A delay in adopting new compliance rules for product marketability or safety data sheets can lead to shipment stops, fines, and market access issues. Companies need a way to receive and implement these updates without being tied to a major software release cycle, ensuring business continuity and unwavering compliance.


Key Feature


With this innovation, we enable continuous content delivery for product marketability (PMA) and safety data sheet (SDS) compliance requirements via the SAP Regulatory Content Service. This decouples regulatory updates from the main software release schedule. Now you can receive the latest rule sets as they are released, allowing you to remain up to date with the newest regulations. This ensures your product portfolio stays compliant without needing to wait for or implement a new SAP S/4HANA Cloud release.

Image #1: Compliance Requirements Versions

 

Dangerous Goods Management

Visualization of information for ADR and RID 1.1.3.6

Business Background

When transporting dangerous goods, specific exemptions can apply under certain conditions, such as the limited quantity provisions in ADR and RID 1.1.3.6 for road and rail transport. For logistics planners and transport operators, having clear and immediate visibility into whether a shipment qualifies for such exemptions is crucial for ensuring both safety and regulatory compliance, while also optimizing transport costs and processes.

 

Key Feature

To provide this visibility, the "View Markings and Labels; Dangerous Goods" app has been renamed to "Dangerous Goods Information; For the Value Chain" and enhanced significantly. This app now visualizes information related to the ADR and RID 1.1.3.6 agreements, making it easy to see exemption applicability. This feature establishes the foundation for integrating this data into freight units, freight orders, and bookings, helping your teams comply with complex dangerous goods regulations more effectively.

 

Image #2: Dangerous Goods Information – For the Value Chain


Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents

Business Background

Operating a global supply chain requires adherence to a diverse and extensive array of transport regulations, each with unique documentation requirements. Manually generating specific dangerous goods notes for different countries and transport modes is inefficient and increases the risk of errors, which can cause transport delays and compliance failures.

 

Key Feature

This release introduces a host of new output scenarios to support a wide range of dangerous goods transport documents. This includes support for UNRTDG, ADG, ANTT, NOM, NCh382, NZS, SANS, JT/T 617.3, and ADN notes. You can now use these scenarios to view descriptions in the Classify Packaged Dangerous Good app and leverage public APIs to create compliant transport documents in external systems. This allows you to optimize the utilization of the rich dangerous goods information managed within SAP S/4HANA.

Image #3: Output scenarios for additional dangerous goods transport documents

 

Integration of mixed loading checks for dangerous goods in sales, delivery, and transportation management

Business Background

A critical aspect of transport safety is preventing the co-loading of incompatible dangerous goods. These mixed loading prohibitions are strictly enforced, and violations can lead to severe accidents and legal penalties. To mitigate this risk, businesses require systematic checks to be performed early and consistently throughout the logistics process, from sales to final transport execution.

 

Key Feature

This enhancement integrates dangerous goods mixed loading checks directly into the core logistics value chain. The system now automatically performs these checks on sales orders and outbound deliveries, as well as within Transportation Management for freight units, freight orders, and bookings. This proactive validation helps you prevent the execution of noncompliant and unsafe transports, safeguarding your people, assets, and brand reputation.

 

Image #4: Analyse Delivery Logs

 

Image #5: Display Logs



Printing dangerous-goods freight documents in transportation management

Business Background

To legally transport dangerous goods, shipments must be accompanied by freight documents containing specific, accurate dangerous goods information. Generating these documents separately from standard freight paperwork is inefficient and creates opportunities for inconsistency and error, jeopardizing compliance.

 

Key Feature

You can now print relevant dangerous goods information together with your standard freight documents directly from Transportation Management. This release provides compliant document templates for key regulations, including the ADR dangerous goods note for European road transport, the RID note for European rail, U.S. and Canadian bills of lading, and the IMDG declaration for ocean transport. This integration ensures you can provide freight documents that are fully compliant with the regulations of various countries.

Image#6: Process Request from Logistics

 

 

Safety Data Sheet and Label Management

Supporting multi-component products for two or more products in the safety data sheet process

Business Background

Many industries sell products as kits or sets that contain multiple distinct chemical components, each of which may legally require its own Safety Data Sheet (SDS). Managing and distributing the correct SDS for every component to the customer can be a complex and manual task, risking incomplete communication of safety information.

 

Key Feature

To address this, we now provide the ability to send safety data sheets for multiple components of a product at the same time. When a product is comprised of two or more items requiring an SDS, the system can now group and transmit all relevant documents in a single, consolidated process. This improves your compliance with SDS regulations and ensures your customers receive complete and accurate safety information efficiently.

Image #7: Safety Data Sheets

 

Image#8: Components



Support for branded products in the safety data sheet process

Business Background

Companies often market an identical substance or mixture under various brand names or trade names to serve different markets or customer segments. Sending the same SDS to a customer multiple times, once for each branded product they purchase, is redundant and can create unnecessary administrative work and confusion for the recipient.

Key Feature

This feature introduces support for branded products in the safety data sheet shipment process. You can now configure the system to manage SDS distribution at the branded-product level. This includes deriving the product name on the SDS from the branded product information. This intelligent handling helps you avoid sending redundant SDS documents to customers, streamlining your compliance processes and improving the customer experience.

Image#9: Branded Product Names

 

More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani


For more information on SAP Cloud ERP Private, check out the following links:

  • Collection blog for Product Compliance here
  • SAP Cloud ERP Private page
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Community
  • Inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Best practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Help Portal Product Page 
  • What's New | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: SAC error "We couldn't connect to your BW system"
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One user is facing error while running the SAC story based on BW live model. Error is ""We couldn't connect to your BW system. Please ask your system administrator to investigate".

Below investigation was done but still issue is not resolved -

  • User is able to login to SAC
  • Can run a Dashboard based on Import Model.
  • Can run AFO report
  • Can not run any live SAC dashboards (tested with multiple dashboards based on BW live models) - So issue is with BW live stories only and specific to the user
  • Shared underlying models and story with view access
  • Tried in Edge and incognito
  • Tried in Chrome and incognito
  • Tried by deleting cache
  • Security team confirmed that user has backend authorizations.
  • User is on VPN
  • Users SSO certificate is valid and trusted
  • User is able to run this link-https://XXXX:XX/sap/bw/ina/GetServerInfo in his browser and getting result.
  • All other users are able to run the report

Could you please suggest? Are there any other tests that user need to do for fixing the issue?

Thanks in advance! 

Thanks,

entry.title: Re: Special GL indicator field/Using Alternative Account...
entry.content:
Hello @KhongHaGiang 

Thank you for your detailed question.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Create Supplier Invoice (App ID F0859) application does not provide support for:

  • Entry of a Special G/L Indicator for down payments or special postings.
  • Manual override of the supplier reconciliation account for the supplier line.

These options are not accessible or cannot be expanded in the Cloud environment, adding them through Custom Fields, a BAdI, or any UI modification is not possible.

Follow be to meet your requirements:

For down payments or specific G/L transactions, utilise Manage Supplier Down Payment Requests to automatically generate and post the relevant G/L entries

For invoices requiring a different G/L account, assign the appropriate reconciliation account in the supplier’s master data. Also note Public Cloud does not allow changing it at invoice level).

To park standard supplier invoices, continue using Create Supplier Invoice (F0859) this is the only supported app for parking non-PO supplier invoices.

References:

  • SAP Note 2856664 – Create Incoming Invoices app does not offer Park functionality; use F0859.
  • SAP KBA-2885884 - Differences between the Create Supplier Invoice (App ID F0859) and Create Incoming Invoices (App ID FB60) apps - SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP KBA-2891863 - App ID F0859: Create Supplier Invoice - Purchase Order selection differs from CSI Advanced Tile - SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Help Portal – Manage Supplier Down Payment Requests (Public Cloud).

Kind regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Vladimirs Semikins (SAP Champion) Expert Playlist for SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin
entry.content:
It's been a while since I last attended SAP Teched in person, the last time was back in 2018 in Barcelona, therefore, I'm really excited to be going to SAP Teched Berlin this year (just in a few weeks), so I wanted to share the sessions I'm planning to attend.
Ok, here we go - besides Keynote, DemmoJam, meeting SAP Community folks, (ex-)colleagues and friends - I would like to attend the following sessions, which are very interesting (or important) from my point of view.
  • ST103 | Accelerating the cloud transition with a guided transition methodology
  • XP200 | Fortifying SAP BTP: Best practices for more-secure software development
  • DA160 | SAP Business Data Cloud from set up to streamline: A practical walk-through
  • AD161 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build
  • CT1257 | SAP Process Orchestration migration: Using AI tools for maximum gains
  • ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • CT1262 | Extending the Smart Way: Hybrid Architecture with SAP BTP, Joule and AI
  • DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private
Also, as a SAP TechEd Berlin registrant, I will try to use opportunity to get free SAP Certification “SAP Generative AI Developer”, more details on how it could be done, you can find here - https://learning.sap.com/teched/certifications
 
Anyway, super excited and looking forward to meeting you all!

entry.title: Freeze Book Inventory UOM Issue during count
entry.content:
Hello EWM gurus,

I have a question specifically about the Freeze Book Inventory flag which can be set in EWM during the creation of the PI document.

We are currently using AUOM's (Alternative Unit of Measure). This means we have the BUOM and the AUOM for some articles in the warehouse. When creating a PI document (regardless of the procedure), if the count is created without the Freeze Book Inventory flag being set, when the user counts the PI doc in the RF, the count shows that it should be counted in the AUOM form.

In the example above, the procedure is HS and the article has a BUOM and an AUOM. During the count, the user is asked to enter the count in the AUOM form, in this case, C01.

If I create another count with the HS procedure for the same article in the same storage type which has the same BUOM and same AUOM but this time, I activate the Freeze Book Inventory flag, when the user goes to count it, the UOM is only displayed in the BUOM and not the AUOM.

I first that maybe in the LIME tables, the stock was stored differently however, in both of these cases, the stock shows in the table with the BUOM. I'm not sure why when the Freeze Book Inventory flag is set, the UOM is changed to only be counted in the BASE form and not the alternative form.

I checked for a while and I can't find anything in the SAP notes in regards to this. Has anyone come across an issue like this or a way to keep the PI doc. from using the BUOM even if the flag is checked?

Thanks,
Scott

Francis, welcome aboard!
Having served as a TQM across both South America and North America, I can tell you this is one of the most challenging yet rewarding roles at SAP. Your experience, as a CEO, in leading executive discussions and articulating solutions will be a tremendous asset.

No one ever starts entirely from scratch — everyone brings something unique to the table. TQM blends technical expertise with strong soft skills you’ll rely on every day, along with stakeholder management, risk management, and de-escalation.

entry.title: Re: SFTP Conection
entry.content:
Hi Aaron101,

 

If you are using an SFTP account provided by SAP and are having login issues when using the SFTP Server URL from KBA 2089448 - SuccessFactors Data Center Name, Location, URL, Domain Name, Mail Server details, SFTP details and Outbound IP addresses - SAP for Me, a password reset would be required. For it, please refer to KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2278826 and open a ticket with LOD-SF-PLT-FTPS with the required details listed on the KBA.

If you are using a third party vendor SFTP for the process described on KBA 2789153 - How to Schedule Change Audit Report and Access It - SAP for Me, please engage with your SFTP vendor to assist with the connection issue and share the connection error received with them.

 

Kind Regards,

Cristian

entry.title: Re: Interviewer not receiving "Interview Confirmation to Interviewer" email
entry.content: @RohitLamgaria786, when outlook is integrated with the interview scheduling system, it automatically generates a calendar invite for the interviewer once the interview is confirmed. Outlook directly sends the email notification to the interviewer. Meanwhile, organizers receive a separate email notification from the SuccessFactors system. Please check whether organizers are assigned as recipients in the "Interview Confirmation to Organizers" email trigger.

entry.title: SAP GCR Access Control 12.0 : SoD Rules don't fire (always no violation)
entry.content:
I am trying to test Web Service Access Risk Analysis (GRAC_RISK_ANALYSIS_WOUT_NO_WS)

Here are my difficulties with SAP:
- I successfully installed SAP S/4 and GRC Access Control 12.0
- I created the connector in Access Control to connect to S/4
- I successfully synchronised the users, roles and authorisations from S/4 in SAP GRC Access Control
- I tried to create a simple SoD rule by importing eight CSV files (but some are empty, like function.csv)
- I tried to generate the corresponding SoD rule (via the link SPRO → Governance, Risk and Compliance → Access Control → Access Risk Analysis → SoD → Generate SoD Rule
- I configured the web service GRAC_RISK_ANALYSIS_WOUT_NO_WS => I can call it successfully, but it always responds: Success, no violation "
 I wonder if my SoD rule was successfully ‘compiled’ during ‘Generate SoD Rule’ => according to my research (ChatGPT) , this is supposed to fill the GRACSYSRULE table, but this table is empty on my system. Is this the table that is supposed to contain the ‘compiled’ SoD rules?

Regards,

Sylvain G.

entry.title: Re: Significant Performance Degradation on Depreciation J...
entry.content:
Hello Guoqiang ,

Thanks for your comment ,

Following the deployment of the recent hotfix, we have performed new tests both in production and in our quality environment. We confirm a significant improvement, with processing times for depreciation jobs reduced by more than half compared to last week. However, the current performance still remains well below our business requirements and is not satisfactory for our client. Given the situation, we kindly but firmly request that SAP provides: A clear commitment on the next steps planned to fully resolve this performance issue An exact date or estimated timeline (ETA) for the delivery of the definitive fix (via CFD, release, or any other means) Any additional recommendations or interim solutions that could help mitigate the impact until the final resolution Our client is awaiting a concrete answer regarding when the performance will return to an acceptable level. We would appreciate a prompt and transparent update on SAP’s action plan and schedule.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,

Anis BEN SALEM

entry.title: Re: Trigger a workflow when a job is scheduled
entry.content:
Hi Nick,

It looks like you would need to find a way to raise this event yourself.  Just because SAP lists an event, does not mean that the conditions to actually trigger it have been configured/implemented.

Tools> Business Workflow> Development> events> Event Creation is the typical path to go to see what methods (not talking class-methods here) are available to trigger an event.  You can use these methods to trigger both custom and SAP-delivered events.  
I first thought that your best best would be to use Change Documents to trigger an event, but this also requires changing some attributes on table TBTCO so that change documents are logged, and I'm not sure you want to go down that road.

I'm not sure if Status Management will work in this case either.

If you can find a user-exit or BADI that is called at the time a job is scheduled, it would be fairly easy to insert code to call SAP_WAPI_CREATE_EVENT in order to raise that event.  Once you can determine via SWEL that the event is being logged, you are well on your way.

Hope this helps,

Sue

PS:  thread related to this: https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/trigger-mail-for-cancelled-background-jobs-scheduled-using-sm37/m-p/7286766/highlight/true

entry.title: Re: Usage of ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) in the cloud for on-premise developments
entry.content:
Hi Jens @JaySchwendemann ,

this blog is still up-to-date, our recommendation for SAP BTP ABAP environment for ATC on SAP BTP is to start with the Standard Plan: 1 block ABAP runtime (16GB) + 2 blocks SAP HANA persistency (2 x 16GB = 32GB) (suitable in most customer scenarios) and increase if really needed.

Kind regards,
Olga.

entry.title: Re: The Power of One: How Unified SAP Joule Boosts AI Adoption (a technical sight)
entry.content:
Hi @normann 

I was looking forward for this architectures. very interesting info.

Would you please clarify on this statement "GUUID is written back to SFSF"

I've raised an incident some days ago and they told me overwritting the UUID once generated is not supported. unfortunately there's no way to disable the UUID writeback to SF as part of the standard SF->IAS either. For most comanies the usage of "id" atribute field from Entra is the most desired scenario but unfortunately IAS writes back the UUID to SF as part of the sync using a random number. I was told overwriting it in a later stage is not supported. can yu clarify please?

entry.title: Re: PO change log report

entry.title: Re: Webinar: Streamlining North American Tax Compliance with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Hello Kevin,

entry.title: Can we have Work Order Header level Assignment with Operation-Level Status Update in SSAM 2505 ?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are implementing SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2505 for one of our clients. The business requirement is to assign work orders at the header level person responsible, but allow status updates at the operation level within the SSAM mobile application.

I have a few clarifications regarding this setup:

  1. Is it technically possible to have header-level work order assignment while performing operation-level status updates in SSAM ?

  2. We were able to achieve this by making some configuration changes, but I’d like to understand if there are any potential side effects or limitations.

Here’s what we did:

  • In the Work Order Generic MDO, we set the Assignment Type to 1 (Header level person responsible).

  • In the parameters, we kept the assignment type for Work Order as 2, rule to derive it from work order generic MDO is disabled.

Could anyone please confirm if this is a valid and supported approach?   Also, are there any known impacts or best practices for this kind of hybrid assignment configuration?

Thank you,
Sudhir Lenka

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2: Final What's New & Product Assistance available
entry.content:
With immediate effect, the final What's New information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2 is now available.

To access the final What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer. In addition, the final Product Assistance (aka Application Help) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2 is available. Please use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Help Portal page to access it.

For you as a customer, we recommend to also use the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool. The Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2 will be available in RASD within the next few days. A valid Customer S-user ID is required for login. We recommend to use RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you as a customer.

You can use the commenting feature for What’s New. With this feature, authors can evaluate your feedback and incorporate it into the documentation, if needed. We hope that by opening this channel of communication, we can learn how to further improve our What’s New content for you. To use this feature, you need to be logged into SAP Help Portal. The feature will only be available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

Dear Customers,

 

SLT provides all the necessary authorizations in the security guide - https://help.sap.com/doc/e9e9a1e3f33342749fb507ec33567f52/latest/en-US/Security_Guide.pdf, this and other guides can be found on the SLT help page - https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_LANDSCAPE_TRANSFORMATION_REPLICATION_SERVER

The authorizations needed for the SLT user are covered in section 5.2.1 User Roles for SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server

Additionally, this is mentioned in KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2658517

 

Best Regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Change profit center hierarchy in group reporting's a...
entry.content:
Hi Tess,
As you explain you have quite number of SAP analysis reports. To efficiently update SAP analysis reports with the new profit center hierarchy, the best approach is to use the “Manage Global Hierarchies” app and recreate or copy reports using the updated hierarchy.

Please find below the best option from best practices.

The Efficient Ways to Update Profit Center Hierarchies are mentioned below.

1. Use the “Manage Global Hierarchies” Fiori App
This app allows you to edit and restructure profit center hierarchies centrally.
Changes made here will reflect in new reports and any apps that dynamically pull from the global hierarchy.
However, existing reports may not auto-update unless they are configured to reference the hierarchy dynamically.

2. Copy Existing Reports and Reassign Hierarchy
Since new reports show the updated hierarchy, copying existing reports and assigning the new hierarchy is a practical workaround.
This ensures that the structure is preserved while aligning with the new hierarchy.
Depending on your SAP version and reporting tool (e.g., SAC, Fiori, BW), you may use:
“Save As” or “Copy” functionality in the report designer
Adjust the data source or hierarchy reference during copy

3. Mass Update via API or Backend Tools
SAP provides APIs and backend tools to update profit center assignments in bulk.
For example, using the Profit Center Group and Hierarchy API, you can asynchronously update hierarchy nodes.
This is ideal for large-scale changes but may require coordination with your SAP technical team.

I will recommend auditing your existing reports to identify which ones are hardcoded to the old hierarchy.
Use the “Manage Global Hierarchies” app to ensure the new hierarchy is properly structured and published.
Recreate or copy reports that don’t reflect the new hierarchy and ensure they reference the updated structure.
If you have many reports, consider automating the update using SAP APIs or scripting tools.

Best Regards

entry.title: Re: Implementing Crossboarding - any advice?
entry.content:
We recently implemented the latest vers of Onboarding and our vers of Crossboarding differed from the prof svc consulting group and SAP's definition of Xboarding. Our xboarding entails internal hires via RMK AND additional promos etc outside of requisitions (level up promos, etc). This cost a lot of time and $ to clarify the change to the orig definition. Our prior Xboarding involved integrations for RH and cross enterprise xfer identification variables. So we had mult layers to contend with. Areas to be very aware of include business rules attributed to compensatory and pos related personnel transactions, immediate timing sends/record application of impacted emp records to external/integrated Payroll systems upon Xboarding/ONB initiation vs eff date, etc. For SOx compliance, Payroll data, and transaction bus rule needs - while we are still  working out additional kinks for Xboarding triggered ONB standard notifications and the like - my best recommendation is to ensure that your HR users and IT teams are well versed in ALL areas within your system from ONB, RCM, and Platform as well as externally impacted integrated systems (IT accts, Payroll, 401k/Benefits, etc) before mapping out needs and show your prof svc vendors how you currently use your sys, what you need or intend to get, and ensure they can support. 

Best of luck! ONB was a challenge, we had a great consulting group that we worked with and a fantastically creative and innovative prof svc consultant who brought huge lifts to life for our ONB/Xboarding conversion.

entry.title: Difference between posting time and entry time for asynchronous APIs
entry.content:
When making postings with asynchronous APIs, I see the posting is successful, but sometimes the posting time is more than an hour after the entry time. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Difference between posting time and entry time for as...
entry.content:
Delays such as these are expected behaviour when dealing with asynchronous APIs in S/4HANA Public Cloud. When a CSV file or external system triggers postings, the system first accepts the inbound request, places it in an internal processing queue, and then executes the posting in the background.

This asynchronous mechanism ensures reliability and data consistency when large volumes of postings are submitted, or when multiple transactions involve the same company code or asset that may temporarily be locked by other processes. It also prevents system contention and improves throughput for mass postings.

As a result, some journal entries may appear with a time delay even though no errors are displayed in the monitoring apps. The initial HTTP or upload confirmation only indicates that the request was successfully received, not that the journal entry has already been posted.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
SAP Logistics Management is designed to bring warehousing and transportation management into a single, integrated solution.  This streamlines operations and enhances collaboration across your network.

As mentioned in the previous What's New article, we're committed to delivering innovation continuously. This way, you can take advantage of new capabilities as soon as they're ready.

Today’s update introduces a powerful enhancement to one of our key apps: Define Processing Rules.

 

Define Processing Rules – Your Automation Engine

The Define Processing Rules app simplifies business process automation. It helps you create, adjust, and manage rule sets that guide decisions in your logistics processes. By defining conditions and outputs, you reduce manual steps, minimize errors, and save time.

If you've used SAP Business Rule Framework plus (BRFplus) before, you'll be familiar with rule-based automation. Unlike generic business rules engines, the Define Processing Rules app is designed specifically for logistics processes. These include carrier determination, freight tendering template selection, and label format determination. You get predefined templates and parameters that make configuration faster and easier.

 

What’s New: Test the Rule Definitions

Until now, defining rules involves deploying them and hoping they work as intended. With this release, that changes:

The new testing feature lets you validate your rules . You can test the rule definitions with sample data to confirm whether the logic is correct or needs adjustment.

The process is as simple as that: Choose your rule set, enter sample input data, and review the simulated output. This approach provides a safe space for you to fine-tune logic and avoid costly mistakes.

Test Rule Definitions

What improvements in your automation strategy would you expect from being able to test your rule definitions?
Feel free to share your thoughts and experiences in the comments section below.

For more details, check out the SAP Help Portal and stay tuned for more updates in SAP Logistics Management.

 

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management | Product Page

SAP Logistics Management | Business Process Automation 

SAP Logistics Management | Learning Session

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud UM’s Event Log Archive and Deletion using SAP Job Scheduling Service
entry.content:
Hey everyone, Inspired by the job scheduler blogpost, Maximizing BTP Job Scheduling Service with SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model, I’d like to share with you one topic which can help administrators in archiving and deleting Event Logs from your tenants in a periodic way.

As a ballpark number coming from four (4) different tenants, a logged event ranges between 150-350 bytes per record depending on trace information. This would mean that when there are about 4 million entries it equates to more or less 1GB of memory consumption.

 

If you are interested in trying it on your tenant, below is an example sql syntax.

SELECT SCHEMA_NAME, TABLE_NAME, RECORD_COUNT,
  MEMORY_SIZE_IN_MAIN  AS MAIN_BYTES,
  MEMORY_SIZE_IN_DELTA AS DELTA_BYTES,
  MEMORY_SIZE_IN_TOTAL AS TOTAL_BYTES,
  ROUND(MEMORY_SIZE_IN_MAIN  / POWER(1024, 3), 5) AS MAIN_GB,
  ROUND(MEMORY_SIZE_IN_DELTA / POWER(1024, 3), 5) AS DELTA_GB,
  ROUND(MEMORY_SIZE_IN_TOTAL / POWER(1024, 3), 5) AS TOTAL_GB,
  MEMORY_SIZE_IN_TOTAL / RECORD_COUNT AS BYTES_PER_RECORD,
  ROUND(MEMORY_SIZE_IN_TOTAL/ RECORD_COUNT / POWER(1024, 3), 8) AS GB_PER_RECORD
FROM SYS.M_CS_TABLES
WHERE TABLE_NAME = 'SAP_ACE_EVENTLOGS';

Given above information, let’s go ahead and see how we can utilize UM released API, Archive of Event Logs in combination with SAP Job Scheduler Service (JSS) to perform the event log cleanup.

Prerequisite
You have gone through Phase I - SAP BTP: Application and Instance Subscriptions and Phase II - SAP BTP: Creation of Customized Application of blogpost, Maximizing BTP Job Scheduling Service with SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model

Procedure
1. Following Phase III - SAP PAPM Cloud UM: Collect API Action URL, Collect Archive Event Log (Action URL) which may come from the system itself by following the dev tools

or use Universal Model - Administration Service > /archive API.

URL will then look like:
<BTP Proxy Application Routes>/ace/<$batch's request url>/<$batch's payload>
https://jobscheduler-papm-proxy.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com /ace/sap/ace/AdministrationService/archive

2. Following Phase IV - SAP JSS: Job Creation, use the generated URL above in order to create the job.


3. Following Phase V - SAP JSS: Job Scheduling, users can a job or several jobs which can be executed in future time. For example, I wanted to delete the logs and create an archive every 5 minutes until end of the year. You can do it by creating a schedule like below:


this will be executed and run logs for the job will have this execution information.

Usage of 5 minutes interval is used only for test purposes but in a real world you may opt to schedule this on a monthly basis or quarterly basis even. You just need to check the proper scheduling value for it. See cron format for more info.

In the end, you will see in the system entry of archived event logs.


In addition, you will also have a cleaner event log list.


That’s all for now. Hope it helped you make use of another useful API which can be used in a scheduled manner in SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model. Until next time!

entry.title: SAP FSM Smartform is read-only
entry.content:
Our customer has a business rule that automatically assigns a Smartform to each new activity. The person responsible for the Smartform is automatically assigned to the technician for the activity. For several months now, the Smartform has sometimes been locked in yellow and the message “Smartform is read-only” appears. Even the technician cannot edit it. The only workaround at present is to always delete the Smartform and recreate it.

I could not find in the documentation under which conditions the smart form becomes read-only. Is it possible to manipulate this status via OData/business rules, or is there a configuration that prevents this behavior?

entry.title: Re: SAC Planning & Reporting: The Version Dimension and its Limitations
entry.content: @JefB thank you for your comment! We also took that decision but I am not a fan of it since copying actuals to forecast contradicts the idea of the forecast layout and data federation in general.
